intro: Corallocarpus ethaicus, commonly known as the Ethaic Starfruit, is a rare and unique plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes other members such as cucumbers and melons. Its leaves are broad and lobed, and it produces small, pale flowers that bloom in clusters. The fruit is not only ornamental but also has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
